item.title: Scatter Plots
item.description: The purpose of this tutorial is to demonstrate how to plot data on a graph using the lahman baseball database. Open a new R Script.The following will need to be installed: lahman,ggplot2,ggiraph, and dplyr.This can be achieved by choosing the Install Packages option under the Tools tab. Once installed, pull from the library as seen below: library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(ggiraph) Now we can begin. Grouping & Filtering Data Under the Insert tab choose R.

item.title: Bar Charts
item.description: The purpose of this tutorial is to demonstrate how to create barcharts using dplyr and the lahman data base. Bar charts are useful for showing the height (numerical value) of a variable. For example, if you survey a room of 100 people on their favorite color you may recieve the following random sample results: blue 45, red 12, purple 20, orange 13, yellow 8, and green 2. A bar chart would list the colors on the X axis, with blue being the highest bar and green the lowest.

item.title: Histograms
item.description: This is the second tutorial on creating historgrams via RStudio. Install the following and pull from the library: library(dplyr) library(Lahman) library(ggplot2) Extracting the Data Assigned the extracted data to result (dataframe). result<-Batting%>% filter(playerID=='ruthba01')%>% select(yearID,SO,HR) Data visualization In the last post, we used ggplot to create a visual representation of the data. In this representation, we are going to name our x and y coordinates with xlab and ylab, repsectively. Use ggiraph to change color characteristics when hovering over the graph.

item.title: Flexdashboard Tutorial
item.description: What is Flexdashboard? Flexdashboard is an R package that allows the user to display data visualizations such as graphs,tables, tables, and widgets on a dashboard. Flexdashboard users can easily make size adjustments to chart proportions, and make the visualizations mobile friendly. An example of flexdashboard being used in this tutorial can be found below: https://kstaud85.github.io/https-kstaud85.github.io-dashboard/ Install and pull the following packages from the library: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(flexdashboard) library(stringr) library(lubridate) The data used today can be found on kaggle, but any data set is suitable: https://www.

item.title: How to Create a Word Cloud
item.description: What is a Word Cloud? A word cloud is an image composed of words whose size is determined by the frequency in which they appear. Today, we will be creating a word cloud from the Tame Impala album, Currents. First, create a word text file, and save the lyrics (no titles) in that file. Save both this file and a new R script file in the same directory. Now we can begin.
